intro: Matelea porphyrocephala, commonly known as the red-headed matelea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its striking red and orange flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, often with a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
